reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Global Disease Detection (GDD) Program

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Center for Global Health (CGH) Division of Global Health Protection (DGHP) Global Disease Detection (GDD) Program builds global health security capacity to respond to infectious disease threats and protect lives by helping countries meet their commitments to the World Health Organization (WHO) International Health Regulations (2005). The GDD Program engages with ministries of health and other implementing partners to improve the local capacity in technical areas such as epidemiology, emergency management and response, laboratory biosafety and biosecurity, quality management systems, and level-appropriate diagnostic methodologies.

title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Global Health Activities

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Center for Global Health (CGH) leads the execution of CDC's global health approach, working in partnership to assist Ministries of Health to plan, manage effectively, and evaluate health programs; achieve U.S. Government program and international organization goals to improve health, including disease eradication and elimination targets; expand CDC's global health programs that focus on the leading causes of mortality, morbidity and disability, especially chronic disease and injuries; generate and apply new knowledge to achieve health goals; and strengthen health systems and their impact.

title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Immunization and Respiratory Diseases (Pandemic Influenza - Rapid Outbreak Response)

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Influenza Division International Program works with a wide range of international partners, including the World Health Organization, National Ministries of Health and others to build capacity to respond to pandemic influenza and to prevent and control seasonal influenza. Core activities include helping establish, expand, and maintain influenza surveillance and laboratory capacity, helping develop global and local pandemic plans and influenza prevention policies, supporting targeted research projects to address critical needs, and building the evidence base for decisions on influenza vaccine program expansion.

title.narrative: Protecting and Improving Health Globally: Building and Strengthening Public Health Impact, Systems, Capacity and Security

description.narrative: Kazakhstan National Center of Expertise: Building and Strengthening Public Health Impact, Systems, Capacity and Security. U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) global health efforts are to assist Ministries of Health and other international partners to plan, manage effectively, and evaluate public health programs; achieve U.S. Government program and international organization goals to improve health, including disease eradication and elimination targets; expand CDC's global health programs that focus on the leading causes of worldwide mortality, morbidity and disability, including chronic disease and injuries; generate and apply new knowledge to achieve health goals; and, strengthen health systems and their impact.
